page.title: 07RECREATION GROUND
page.content: Ampthill park is an area for play, nature and for sports .Ampthill park is not very woody although there are many trees and woods around it. There is a lot of wildlife including deer, moles and many birds. There is one reservoir with several more little ponds around it.There is a tennis court, football pitch and stand.There is also a cricket square a rugby pitch and two car parks. There are cows up at the park because it is used for grazing land. It is on a very big hill.There is a scout HQ up there as well.In one area there is a childrens playground with all the usual playground equipment. In the park are two crosses,one remembers the WW1 army camp and the other ,which is called "Katherine's Cross", is in memory of Katherine of Aragon who was held at Ampthill castle.
